alert.note: Alert for Iron; Kane; Washington (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 11:11AM MDT until August 02 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: The National Weather Service in Salt Lake City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Iron County in southern Utah... Northwestern Kane County in southern Utah... Southeastern Washington County in southwestern Utah... * Until 300 PM MDT. * At 1111 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible as these storms move through Zion National Park and the surrounding area, including Hildale. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Zion National Park, La Verkin, Apple Valley, Hildale, Virgin, Springdale, Kanarraville, Rockville and Kolob Canyon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
